New Records: The Heat's 119-108 win over the Pelicans marked the 100th time in NBA history that a team has had a road losing streak of 15 or more in the same season
Key Match Events: Tyler Herro scored 32 points, Bam Adebayo flirted with a triple-double, and the Heat never trailed in the 119-108 win over the Pelicans
Trey Murphy III scored 34 for the Pelicans, who never led in the game
Pre-Game Insights: Jimmy Butler, in his first game following a five-game absence because of illness, had nine points, four rebounds, and two assists in 25 minutes on 3-for-5 shooting
Post-Match Reflections: The Heat is now 12-9 in games where Butler plays this season
The Pelicans lost for the 29th time in their last 32 games and are 1-20 in their last 21 contests
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pelicans have dropped 15 in a row on the road
CJ McCollum scored 22 for New Orleans, and Murphy's 34 points tied for the third-most by a Pelicans player this season
Others: The Heat host Indiana on Thursday, and the Pelicans host Washington on Friday
